title: HELP! Can't install or uninstall LoL ? :(
body:
Months ago I've tried to remove LoL by deleting every file concerning it, but when i go to programs/features I am unable to uninstall League of Legends because I am missing a file called **"LoL.NA.msi"** (Ive always played on OCE). 

When I tried installing the game recently, it always came as a "vcredist" error, or an error to install since I have an older version of the game already. But I can't uninstall it? :(

replies.body:
That is not how you are meant to uninstall programs, because doing that will leave all entries in your registry regarding the program you deleted as still installed, which causes many bugs and glitches. Since you ultimately deleted what was there to clean the reg, you're going to have to do it manually, which is risky if you don't know what you're doing.

Firstly, what OS are you using?

Yeah, using my boyfriends laptop and they deleted it because he hates LoL since he plays DoTA. T-T long story.

Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium? x64-based PC

Ok, well we can manually go through the registry using regedit (Windows comes with this) and remove all entries saying that League is still installed on your computer. It's quite complicated, though, and risky (as in, you can stop your computer running at all).  Before attempting this, create a system repair disc and (if possible) back up all of your data to another drive.

All the following instructions where text is in quotation marks are typed in without those marks. Eg. "regedit.exe" would be typed in as
>regedit.exe

Open up regedit by pressing Winkey+R and typing in "regedit.exe". Click "Ok" to the prompt asking you to allow the program to edit files.

Click "File", "Export" and save the file to somewhere easily accessible. This is a backup of your registry as it currently is; having it could easily fix some problems you run into.

The rest of the instructions are very lengthy, thus I'll wait to see if you're actually going through with this before continuing. I'll be back in about half an hour to see.

Oh I see, it's not officially my laptop so I don't want to do anything to it that could be detrimental. For the time being, I'll just take a break from playing then and get an old IT friend to help me out in person. 

Thank you though, if I later on decide to continue with this then I'll go straight to you :)

Alrighty, I'll get to you when I'm browsing the boards and see a new notification.

Hopefully the IT guy can fix it, mainly because editing the reg is a bit confusing (apparently folders are keys, but the keys only exist in the registry, but they act just like folders!)

Best of luck.

Sorry to bug you again, but when I open *lol.launcher * in my Riot Games > League of Legends folder. a RADS error shows up saying it could not connect to HTTP server. *Please check that your internet connection is enabled and that your firewall is not blocking access.* However, on my Allowed Programs through firewall list, League of Legends is not there. Is that connected with my previous issue?
It probably would be. Have you tried adding it?
